sen.j: 皇太子（こうたいし、Crown Prince）は、皇位継承（帝位継承）の第一順位にある皇子を指す称号。
sen.e: "Kotaishi" (Crown Prince) is a title of a prince with the first rank of succession to the Imperial Throne.
Crown Prince is the title of a prince at the top of the order of succession to the Imperial Throne.
sen.cmt: 後にkotaishiの読みが必要な個所がありますのでKotaishiとつけました。
sen.e: Kotaishi' (Crown Prince) is the Japanese word used to refer to the prince that is next in line to the imperial throne in Japan.
sen.cmt: 実際niKotaishi'が入力されていないのでつけました。

sen.j: 王位継承の第一順位については、王太子、または単に太子という。
sen.e: He was called Otaishi or Taishi with the first rank of succession to the Imperial Throne.
Those who is at the top of the order of succession to the Throne is called Otaishi or Taishi.
sen.cmt: The above cell refers to the succession of an emperor and ｔhis cell refers to that of a king.
sen.e: The Japanese word used to refer to the prince that is next in line to a royal throne in other countries, however, is "Otaishi" or just "Taishi".

sen.j: 敬称は「殿下」が用いられる。
sen.e: 'Imperial Highness' is used as a title of honor.
Imperial Highness' is used as his title of honor.
Imperial Highness' is used as his title of honor.

sen.j: また、当代（今上天皇）に準じた礼遇を受ける。
sen.e: He meets with courteous reception like the present emperor.
He receives the same courteous reception as the present emperor.
sen.cmt: フレーズを修正しました。
sen.e: He receives the same courteous reception as the present emperor.

sen.j: 皇太子は、東宮、春宮、または、太子と表記され、「とうぐう」「ひつぎのみこ」「はるのみや」などと読まれた。
sen.e: Crown prince is represented by 東宮 (Togu), 春宮 (Hitsuginomiko) or 太子 (Taishi).
Crown prince is represented as 東宮 (Togu), 春宮 (Hitsuginomiko) or 太子 (Taishi).
Crown prince is represented as 東宮 (Togu), 春宮 (Hitsuginomiko) or 太子 (Taishi).

sen.j: 朝廷では、皇位を継ぐべき皇子や、継承資格を有する皇子に大兄とつけて「大兄皇子」と敬称した。
sen.e: In the Imperial Court, the crown prince who succeeds the throne or who is entitled to succeed it is called 'Oenomiko'.
In the Imperial Court, the crown prince who succeeds the throne or who is entitled to succeed it is called 'Oenomiko'.
In the Imperial Court, the crown prince who succeeds the throne or who is entitled to succeed it is called 'Oenomiko'.

sen.j: もっとも、大兄皇子とは皇太子とは必ずしも同義ではない。
sen.e: Oenomiko and prince do not necessarily have the same meaning.
Oenomiko and Crown Prince do not necessarily have the same meaning.
sen.cmt: 皇太子の訳を修正しました。
sen.e: Oenomiko and Crown Prince do not necessarily have the same meaning.

sen.j: 大兄皇子と敬称されたとしても、絶対的にその地位を保証するものではなく、同時に複数名存在することもあった。
sen.e: Even if he is called Oenomiko, his position is not guaranteed absolutely, and there may be several princes called Oenomiko.
Even if he is called Oenomiko, his position is not guaranteed absolutely, and there may be several princes called Oenomiko.
Even if he is called Oenomiko, his position is not guaranteed absolutely, and there may be several princes called Oenomiko.

sen.j: 皇太子は、必ずしも今上天皇の長男を指すとは限らない。
sen.e: Crown prince does not always refer to the first son of the present emperor.
Crown prince does not always refer to the first son of the present emperor.
Crown prince does not always refer to the first son of the present emperor.

sen.j: 歴史的に皇位は、長幼の序を重んじつつ、本人の能力や外戚の勢力を考慮して決定され、長男であれば必ず皇太子になれるとは限らなかった。
sen.e: Historically, the Imperial Throne was determined by considering choyo no jo (a uniform order between senior and junior) and capabilities of children and influences of maternal relatives, and the first son could not always become crown prince.

Historically, the Imperial Throne was determined by considering choyo no jo (a uniform order between senior and junior) and capabilities of children and influences of maternal relatives, and the first son could not always become crown prince.

Historically, the Imperial Throne was determined by considering choyo no jo (a uniform order between senior and junior) and capabilities of children and influences of maternal relatives, and the first son could not always become crown prince.

sen.j: それゆえ、皇位継承順位が明文化される以前には、皇太子は立太子された当今の子という意味をもつに過ぎない。
sen.e: Before the order of succession to the Imperial Throne was stipulated, the crown prince meant the son of the current emperor, who was formally installed as Crown Prince.
Before the order of succession to the Imperial Throne was stipulated, the crown prince meant the son of the current emperor, who was formally installed as Crown Prince.
Before the order of succession to the Imperial Throne was stipulated, the crown prince meant the son of the current emperor, who was formally installed as Crown Prince.

sen.j: また、南北朝時代 (日本)から江戸時代中期にかけては、次期皇位継承者が決定されている場合であっても、「皇太子」にならないこともあった。
sen.e: In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the mid Edo period, the next heir to the Imperial Throne often did not become 'crown prince' even if he was determined.
In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the mid Edo period, the next heir to the Imperial Throne often did not become 'crown prince' even if he was determined.
In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the mid Edo period, the next heir to the Imperial Throne often did not become 'crown prince' even if he was determined.

sen.j: これは、当時の皇室の財政難などにより、立太子礼が行えなかったためである。
sen.e: This was because the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince could not be carried out due to economic difficulties of the imperial family.
This was because the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince could not be carried out due to economic difficulties of the imperial family.
This was because the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince could not be carried out due to economic difficulties of the imperial family.

sen.j: 通例であれば、次期皇位承継者が決定されると同時に、もしくは日を改めて速やかに立太子礼が開かれ、次期皇位継承者は皇太子になる。
sen.e: Normally, when the next heir to the Imperial Throne is determined, the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince is carried out at the same time or immediately and the hair becomes Crown Prince.

Normally, when the next heir to the Imperial Throne is determined, the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince is carried out at the same time or immediately after a few days and the heir becomes Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。「日を改めて」の訳を補いました。
sen.e: Normally, when the next heir to the Imperial Throne is determined, the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince is carried out at the same time or immediately after a few days and the heir becomes Crown Prince.

sen.j: しかし、立太子礼を経ない場合には、「皇太子」ではなく、「儲君」（ちょくん、もうけのきみ）と呼ばれた。
sen.e: However, if the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was not performed, he was called chokun (crown prince), not 'crown prince'.
However, if the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was not performed, he was called 'chokun' (crown prince) instead of 'kotaishi' (crown prince).
sen.cmt: 言い回しを修正しました。
sen.e: However, if the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was not performed, he was called 'chokun' (crown prince) instead of 'kotaishi' (crown prince).

sen.j: （なお南北朝以前にも光孝天皇・後白河天皇・後堀河天皇などのように立太子されない例もあるが、いずれも急遽擁立された例である）。
sen.e: (There were cases in which the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was not performed, like Emperor Koko, Emperor Goshirakawa, and Emperor Gohorikawa, before the Northern and Southern Dynasties, because they enthroned emperors suddenly.

(There were cases in which the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was not performed, like Emperor Koko, Emperor Goshirakawa, and Emperor Gohorikawa, before the Northern and Southern Dynasties, because they were enthroned suddenly.

(There were cases in which the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was not performed, like Emperor Koko, Emperor Goshirakawa, and Emperor Gohorikawa, before the Northern and Southern Dynasties, because they were enthroned suddenly.

sen.j: 南朝 (日本)では最後まで曲がりなりにも立太子礼が行われてきたとされている。
sen.e: It is considered that the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was carried out to the end the Southern Court (Japan).
It is considered that the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was carried out after a manner to the end of the Southern Court (Japan).
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。「曲がりなりにも」の訳を補いました。
sen.e: It is considered that the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was carried out after a manner to the end of the Southern Court (Japan).

sen.j: これに対して、北朝 (日本)においては、後円融天皇から南北朝合一を遂げた後の霊元天皇に至るまで、300年以上にわたって立太子を経ない儲君が皇位に就いている。
sen.e: On the contrary, chokun (crown princes) succeeded to the Imperial Throne without carrying out the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince for more than 300 years in the Northern Court (Japan), from Emperor Goenyu to Emperor Reigen after the unification of Southern and Northern Courts.

On the contrary, chokun succeeded to the Imperial Throne without carrying out the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince for more than 300 years in the Northern Court (Japan), from Emperor Goenyu to Emperor Reigen who was enthroned after the unification of Southern and Northern Courts.
sen.cmt: 重複した説明を削除しました。文法を修正しました。
sen.e: On the contrary, chokun succeeded to the Imperial Throne without carrying out the ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince for more than 300 years in the Northern Court (Japan), from Emperor Goenyu to Emperor Reigen who was enthroned after the unification of Southern and Northern Courts.

sen.j: 当今の弟が次期継承者である場合には、皇太弟（こうたいてい）、また当今の孫である場合は皇太孫（こうたいそん）と呼ばれる場合がある。
sen.e: If a younger brother of the current emperor is the next heir to the Imperial Throne, he is called kotaitei (the younger brother of an Emperor who is heir apparent), and if he is a grandson of the current emperor, he is called a son of the crown prince.

If a younger brother of the current emperor is the next heir to the Imperial Throne, he is called kotaitei (the younger brother of an Emperor who is heir apparent), and if he is a grandson of the current emperor, he is called kotaison (grandson of an Emperor who is heir apparent).
sen.cmt: 皇太孫の説明をkotaison (grandson of an Emperor who is heir apparent)としました。
sen.e: If a younger brother of the current emperor is the next heir to the Imperial Throne, he is called kotaitei (the younger brother of an Emperor who is heir apparent), and if he is a grandson of the current emperor, he is called kotaison (grandson of an Emperor who is heir apparent).

sen.j: 日本で女性が皇太子となったのは過去に一例のみ、奈良時代の孝謙天皇が皇太子から即位した。
sen.e: There was only one case in which a woman became a crown princess; Empress Koken succeeded to the Imperial Throne from the crown princess in the Nara period.
There was only one case in which a woman became a crown princess; Empress Koken succeeded to the Imperial Throne after having been the crown princess in the Nara period.
There was only one case in which a woman became a crown princess; Empress Koken succeeded to the Imperial Throne after having been the crown princess in the Nara period.

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）、皇室の家内法として皇室典範（旧皇室典範）が定められ、皇位継承順位が明文化された。
sen.e: In 1889, the Imperial House Act (Former Imperial House Act) was established as a household law in the imperial court and the order of succession to the Imperial Throne was specified clearly.
In 1889, the Imperial House Law (Former Imperial House Law) was established as a household law in the imperial court and the order of succession to the Imperial Throne was specified clearly.
sen.cmt: 皇室典範の訳を単語リストに揃えました。
sen.e: In 1889, the Imperial House Law (Former Imperial House Law) was established as a household law in the imperial court and the order of succession to the Imperial Throne was specified clearly.

sen.j: この旧皇室典範15条では、儲嗣タル皇子を皇太子としていた。
sen.e: Article 15 of the Former Imperial House Act specified that a prince who was an heir was crown prince.
Article 15 of the Former Imperial House Law specified that a prince who was an heir was crown prince.
sen.cmt: 皇室典範の訳を単語リストに揃えました。
sen.e: Article 15 of the Former Imperial House Law specified that a prince who was an heir was crown prince.

sen.j: 昭和22年（1947年）に法律として定められた現行の皇室典範8条前段では、皇嗣たる皇子が皇太子とされている。
sen.e: The first part of article 8 of the current Imperial House Act that was established in 1947 specified that a prince who was an heir was crown prince.
The first part of article 8 of the current Imperial House Law that was established in 1947 specified that a prince who was the heir was the crown prince.
The first part of article 8 of the current Imperial House Law that was established in 1947 specified that a prince who was the heir was the crown prince.

sen.j: 「儲嗣」もしくは「皇嗣」は、いずれも最も嫡系に近い皇族男子を指す。
sen.e: Imperial Heir' or 'Crown Prince' refers to a legitimate son of the imperial family.
Both 'Imperial Heir' and 'Crown Prince' refer to a legitimate son of the imperial family.
Both 'Imperial Heir' and 'Crown Prince' refer to a legitimate son of the imperial family.

sen.j: また、皇位継承順位の変更は、「皇嗣精神若ハ身体ノ不治ノ重患アリ又ハ重大ノ事故アルトキ」（旧典範9条）、「精神若しくは身体の不治の重患があり、又は重大な事故があるとき」（現典範3条）のみに許されている。
sen.e: The order of succession to the Imperial Throne is permitted only if 'The Crown Prince has any mental or physical incurable diseases or serious defects' (Article 9 of Former Imperial House Act) or 'has any mental or physical incurable diseases or serious defects' (Article 3 of Imperial House Act).

The change of the order of succession to the Imperial Throne is permitted only if 'The Crown Prince has any mental or physical incurable diseases or serious hindrance' (Article 9 of Former Imperial House Act) or 'has any mental or physical incurable diseases or serious hindrance' (Article 3 of Imperial House Law).
sen.cmt: 「変更」の訳を補いました。皇室典範の訳を単語リストに揃えました。Defectをhindranceに変えました。ご参考→http://www.kunaicho.go.jp/e-kunaicho/hourei-01.html
sen.e: The change of the order of succession to the Imperial Throne is permitted only if 'The Crown Prince has any mental or physical incurable diseases or serious hindrance' (Article 9 of Former Imperial House Act) or 'has any mental or physical incurable diseases or serious hindrance' (Article 3 of Imperial House Law).

sen.j: このため、皇室典範制定以前と異なり、立太子の礼は皇太子の地位の要件ではない。
sen.e: Thus, unlike before the establishment of the Imperial House Act, the ceremony of investiture of the Crown Prince is not a requirement of the position of the crown prince.
Thus, unlike before the establishment of the Imperial House Law, the ceremony of investiture of the Crown Prince is not a requirement of the position of the crown prince.
Thus, unlike before the establishment of the Imperial House Law, the ceremony of investiture of the Crown Prince is not a requirement of the position of the crown prince.

sen.j: 立太子の礼は、天皇における即位の礼と同様、内外に地位を宣明するための儀式である。
sen.e: The ceremony of investiture of the Crown Prince is carried out to declare his position to the public in the same way as the Sokui no rei (ceremony of the enthronement).
The ceremony of investiture of the Crown Prince is carried out to declare his position to the public in the same way as the Sokui no rei (ceremony of the enthronement).
The ceremony of investiture of the Crown Prince is carried out to declare his position to the public in the same way as the Sokui no rei (ceremony of the enthronement).

sen.j: 江戸時代以前には、幼少の儲君の立太子礼も行われた。
sen.e: The ceremonial investiture of the infant Crown Prince was carried out before the Edo period.
The ceremonial investiture of the infant Crown Prince was carried out before the Edo period.
The ceremonial investiture of the infant Crown Prince was carried out before the Edo period.

sen.j: これに対して、皇室典範制定後は、皇太子の成年を待って立太子の礼を行う。
sen.e: The ceremonial investiture of an infant Crown Prince was carried out after the crown prince becomes an adult after the establishment of the Imperial House Act.
On the contrary, after the establishment of the Imperial House Law, the ceremonial investiture of a Crown Prince is carried out after the crown prince becomes an adult.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを補い、語句の順番と、時制を修正しました。
sen.e: On the contrary, after the establishment of the Imperial House Law, the ceremonial investiture of a Crown Prince is carried out after the crown prince becomes an adult.

sen.j: なお、皇太子および皇太孫の成年は18歳とされている（旧典範13条、現典範22条）。
sen.e: The crown prince and son of the crown prince become adults at the age of 18 (Article 13 of Former Imperial House Act, Article 22 of Imperial House Act).
The crown prince and son of the crown prince become adults at the age of 18 (Article 13 of Former Imperial House Law, Article 22 of current Imperial House Law).
sen.cmt: 皇室典範の訳を単語リストに揃えました。
sen.e: The crown prince and son of the crown prince become adults at the age of 18 (Article 13 of Former Imperial House Law, Article 22 of current Imperial House Law).

sen.j: 現行皇室典範施行後、立太子の礼は2回行われた。
sen.e: The ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was carried out twice after establishment of the current Imperial House Act.
The ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was carried out twice after the establishment of the current Imperial House Law.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を補いました。皇室典範の訳を単語リストに揃えました。
sen.e: The ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince was carried out twice after the establishment of the current Imperial House Law.

sen.j: 明仁の立太子の礼（昭和27年（1952年）11月10日）
sen.e: The ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince of Akihito (November 10, 1952)
The ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince Akihito (November 10, 1952)
The ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince Akihito (November 10, 1952)

sen.j: 徳仁親王の立太子の礼（平成3年（1991年）2月23日）
sen.e: The ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince of Imperial Prince Naruhito (February 23, 1991)
The ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince of Imperial Prince Naruhito (February 23, 1991)
The ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince of Imperial Prince Naruhito (February 23, 1991)

sen.j: また、成年の皇太子は、摂政着任の第一順位でもある。
sen.e: The adult crown prince has the first rank for becoming Sessho (regent)
The adult crown prince is placed at the top of the order to become Sessho (regent).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: The adult crown prince is first in line to become a Sessho (regent).

sen.j: 天皇に「精神若しくは身体の疾患又は事故があるとき」であっても、それが一時的なものであり、摂政を置くまでに至らない場合には、国事行為臨時代行が置かれる（国事行為の臨時代行に関する法律）。
sen.e: If the emperor has 'mental or physical diseases or defects', but they are temporary and Sessho (regent) is not required, a temporary agent for emperor's constitutional functions is assigned (law concerning agency for emperor's constitutional functions).

If the emperor has 'mental or physical diseases or hindrance', but they are temporary and Sessho (regent) is not required, a temporary agent for emperor's constitutional functions is assigned (law concerning agency for emperor's constitutional functions).
sen.cmt: 自然な文章になるように修正しました。
sen.e: If the emperor has 'mental or physical diseases or hindrance', but they are temporary and Sessho (regent) is not required, a temporary agent for emperor's constitutional functions is assigned (law concerning agency for emperor's constitutional functions).

sen.j: この国事行為臨時代行の着任順位も、摂政に準じる。
sen.e: The order of becoming the agent for emperor's constitutional functions is the same as that of Sessho (regent).
The order of becoming the agent for emperor's constitutional functions is the same as that of Sessho (regent).
The order of becoming the agent for emperor's constitutional functions is the same as that of Sessho (regent).

sen.j: 大正10年（1921年）から大正15年（1926年）まで、皇太子の昭和天皇が摂政となった。
sen.e: The crown prince (later Emperor Showa) became Sessho from 1921 to 1926.
The crown prince (later Emperor Showa) became Sessho from 1921 to 1926.
The crown prince (later Emperor Showa) became Sessho from 1921 to 1926.

sen.j: 王政復古 (日本)以降、皇太子以外の者が摂政となった例はない。
sen.e: Only crown princes became Sessho after the Restoration of Imperial Rule in Japan.
Only crown princes became Sessho after the Restoration of Imperial Rule in Japan.
Only crown princes became Sessho after the Restoration of Imperial Rule in Japan.

sen.j: 国事行為臨時代行については、昭和天皇病気療養時に、皇太子明仁親王の外国旅行が重なり、皇長孫である徳仁親王が代行となった例がある。
sen.e: There was a case in which Imperial Prince Naruhito who was a legitimate son became an agent when Emperor Showa was treated medically and Crown Prince Akihito went abroad.
There was a case in which Imperial Prince Naruhito, the first grandson of the Emperor Showa, became an agent when Emperor Showa was treated medically and Crown Prince Akihito was traveling abroad.
sen.cmt: 自然な文章になるように修正しました。
sen.e: There was a case in which Imperial Prince Naruhito, the first grandson of the Emperor Showa, became an agent when Emperor Showa was treated medically and Crown Prince Akihito was traveling abroad.

sen.j: 皇太子と皇太子妃の敬称は、他の親王・王とその妃、および内親王・女王と同様に殿下である（現行皇室典範23条2項）。
sen.e: The titles of honor of crown prince and crown princess are Imperial Highness like other Imperial Prince and Imperial Princess, Imperial Princess and princess (Clause 2 of Article 23 of the current Imperial House Act).

The titles of honor of crown prince and crown princess are Imperial Highness like other Imperial Princes and their empresses and Imperial Princesses and princesses (Clause 2 of Article 23 of the current Imperial House Law).
sen.cmt: 皇室典範の訳を単語リストに揃えました。「その妃」の訳を修正しました。
sen.e: The titles of honor of crown prince and crown princess are Imperial Highness like other Imperial Princes and their empresses and Imperial Princesses and princesses (Clause 2 of Article 23 of the current Imperial House Law).

sen.j: 皇太子は、皇統譜では、皇太親王と記述される。
sen.e: Crown prince is described as Pacific Prince Imperial in Kotofu (the genealogy of the Imperial Family).
sen.cmt: 皇太親王は、インターネットからPacific Prince Imperialとしました。
sen.e: Crown prince is described as Pacific Prince Imperial in Kotofu (the genealogy of the Imperial Family).
Kotaishi (crown prince) is described as 'Kotai Shino' in Kotofu (the genealogy of the Imperial Family).
sen.cmt: Crown prince→Kotaishi (crown prince)Pacific Prince Imperial→'Kotai Shinno'(Wikipediaで確認しましたが、このような用語はありませんでした。Webで調べてもヒットしませんでしたが、原文に忠実に訳しております。

tit.j: 皇太弟・皇太甥・皇太孫
tit.e: Kotaitei (the younger brother of an Emperor who is heir apparent), nephew of the crown prince, son of the crown prince
Kotaitei (the younger brother of an Emperor who is heir apparent), Kotaisei (the nephew of an Emperor who is heir apparent, Kotaison (grandson of an Emperor who is heir apparent)
tit.cmt: 「皇太甥・皇太孫」の訳が間違っていると思われますので訂正しました。ご参考→http://www.kunaicho.go.jp/e-kunaicho/hourei-01.html#TOP
tit.e: Kotaitei (the younger brother of an Emperor who is heir apparent), Kotaisei (the nephew of an Emperor who is heir apparent, Kotaison (grandson of an Emperor who is heir apparent)

sen.j: 現在の皇室典範には、皇太弟と皇太甥に関する記載はない。
sen.e: The current Imperial House Act does not specify kotaitei or nephews of the crown prince.
The current Imperial House Law does not mention kotaitei or kotaisei.
sen.cmt: 「皇太甥」の訳が間違っているので訂正しました。
sen.e: The current Imperial House Law does not mention kotaitei or kotaisei.

sen.j: 「皇太孫」は皇室典範に記載があり、「皇嗣たる皇孫」（皇室典範8条後段）のこととされる。
sen.e: The current Imperial House Act stipulates the 'son of the crown prince' is an 'imperial descendant who can be crown prince' (the latter part of Article 8 of Imperial House Act).
The current Imperial House Law mentions kotaison as the 'grandson of the Emperor, who is the Imperial Heir' (the latter part of Article 8 of Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 「皇太孫」の訳が間違っているので訂正しました。
sen.e: The current Imperial House Law mentions kotaison as the 'grandson of the Emperor, who is the Imperial Heir' (the latter part of Article 8 of Imperial House Act).

tit.j: ヨーロッパ諸国の王太子・皇太子

sen.j: 日本語の「（男性の）皇太子」にあたる語は、英語ではCrown Prince、ドイツ語ではKronprinzである。
sen.e: The Japanese word '皇太子' corresponds to Crown Prince in English and Kronprinz in German.
The Japanese word 'Kotaishi' corresponds to Crown Prince in English and Kronprinz in German.
sen.cmt: 皇太子をローマ字表記に修正しました。
sen.e: The Japanese word 'Kotaishi' corresponds to Crown Prince in English and Kronprinz in German.

sen.j: これは実際にドイツなどで称号として用いられていた。
sen.e: This was actually used as a title in Germany and other countries.
This was actually used as a title in Germany and other countries.
This was actually used as a title in Germany and other countries.

sen.j: この語は、今日では主にスカンディナヴィア諸王国の王太子の呼称として用いられる。
sen.e: Today this word is mainly used as a title of crown prince in Scandinavian countries.
Today this word is mainly used as a title of crown prince in Scandinavian countries.
Today this word is mainly used as a title of crown prince in Scandinavian countries.

sen.j: 現在のノルウェーの王太子ホーコン (ノルウェー王太子)はH.K.H. Kronprins Haakonと呼ばれ、これは英語に訳すとHRH Crown Prince Haakonとなる。
sen.e: The current Norwegian crown prince Haakon (Norwegian crown prince) is called H.K.H. Kronprins Haakon, which is translated to HRH Crown Prince Haakon in English.
The current Norwegian crown prince Haakon (Norwegian crown prince) is called H.K.H. Kronprins Haakon, which is translated to HRH Crown Prince Haakon in English.
The current Norwegian crown prince Haakon (Norwegian crown prince) is called H.K.H. Kronprins Haakon, which is translated to HRH Crown Prince Haakon in English.

sen.j: 一方、神聖ローマ帝国の皇太子には「ローマ王（Rex Romanorum）」の称号が授けられていたが、これはハプスブルク家による帝位世襲化以降のことである。
sen.e: The crown prince of the Holy Roman Empire was given a title of 'Rex Romanorum' after the heredity of the crown by the Hapsburg.
The crown prince of the Holy Roman Empire was given a title of 'Rex Romanorum' after the heredity of the crown by the Hapsburg was established.
The crown prince of the Holy Roman Empire was given a title of 'Rex Romanorum' after the heredity of the crown by the Hapsburg was established.

sen.j: ハプスブルク家の皇帝は、次期皇帝としての「ローマ王」の称号を自家の後継者に与えることで、帝位の世襲を維持した。
sen.e: The emperor of the Hapsburg gave a title of 'Rex Romanorum' as the next emperor to his successor to maintain heredity of the crown.
The emperors of the Hapsburg gave the title of 'Rex Romanorum' as the next emperor to his successor to maintain heredity of the crown.
The emperors of the Hapsburg gave the title of 'Rex Romanorum' as the next emperor to his successor to maintain heredity of the crown.

sen.j: これとは異なるが、フランス第一帝政ナポレオン・ボナパルトも息子ナポレオン2世を「ローマ王」に任命している。
sen.e: Napoleon BONAPARTE of the First French Empire appointed his son Napoleon II as 'Rex Romanorum'.
Napoleon BONAPARTE of the First French Empire appointed his son Napoleon II as 'Rex Romanorum'.
Napoleon BONAPARTE of the First French Empire appointed his son Napoleon II as 'Rex Romanorum'.

sen.j: オランダ、スペインなどにおいても、貴族としての儀礼称号が法定推定相続人に与えられる。
sen.e: Ceremonial titles are given to apparent heirs as nobles in the Netherlands, Spain, and other countries.
Ceremonial titles are given to apparent heirs as nobles in the Netherlands, Spain, and other countries.
Ceremonial titles are given to apparent heirs as nobles in the Netherlands, Spain, and other countries.

sen.j: オランダ王太子の称号である「オラニエ公（Prins van Oranje）」は、オランダ王家であるオラニエ＝ナッサウ家当主が、オランダ王国成立以前には南フランスのオランジュ（Orange、オランダ語でOranje）の領主・オラニエ公でもあったことに由来する。
sen.e: The title 'Prins van Oranje' of the crown prince of the Netherlands is derived from a fact that the head of the royal family, Oranje-Nassau family, was a feudal lord of Orange (Oranje in Dutch), Prins van Oranje, before the foundation of the Netherlands.
sen.cmt: オラニエ＝ナッサウ家はOranje-Nassau familyとしました。
sen.e: The title 'Prins van Oranje' of the crown prince of the Netherlands is derived from a fact that the head of the royal family, Oranje-Nassau family, was a feudal lord of Orange (Oranje in Dutch), Prins van Oranje, in southern France before the foundation of the Netherlands.
sen.cmt: 南フランスの訳を補いました。
sen.e: The title 'Prins van Oranje' of the crown prince of the Netherlands is derived from a fact that the head of the royal family, Oranje-Nassau family, was a feudal lord of Orange (Oranje in Dutch), Prins van Oranje, in southern France before the foundation of the Netherlands.

sen.j: スペインの王太子は「アストゥリアス公（Príncipe de Asturias）」の称号を持つ。
sen.e: The crown prince of Spain has a title of 'Principe de Asturias'.
The crown prince of Spain has a title of 'Principe de Asturias'.
The crown prince of Spain has a title of 'Principe de Asturias'.

sen.j: フランス王国では王太子に「ドーファン（dauphin）」の称号が与えられた。
sen.e: The crown prince in the Kingdom of France was given a title of 'dauphin'.
The crown prince in the Kingdom of France was given a title of 'dauphin'.
The crown prince in the Kingdom of France was given a title of 'dauphin'.

sen.j: 元々はフランス南東部のドーフィネ（Dauphiné）地方の領主の称号であったが、1349年に同地方を併合して王太子領として以降、王太子の称号となった。
sen.e: It was originally a title of a feudal lord in the Dauphine region at the south-eastern part of France, but it became a title of crown prince after the region was absorbed as a crown prince region in 1349.

It was originally a title of a feudal lord in the Dauphine region at the south-eastern part of France, but it became a title of crown prince after the region was absorbed as a crown prince region in 1349.

It was originally a title of a feudal lord in the Dauphine region at the south-eastern part of France, but it became a title of crown prince after the region was absorbed as a crown prince region in 1349.

sen.j: ロシア帝国では、上記の諸国のような貴族的称号ではないが、皇太子に対して「皇帝（ツァーリ）の息子」という意味の語である「ツァレヴィチ（царевич, tsarevich）」という呼称が用いられた。
sen.e: In the Russian Empire, the word 'царевич, tsarevich' that means 'son of czar' is used instead of the aristocratic title in the above countries.
In the Russian Empire, the word 'царевич, tsarevich' that means 'son of czar' was used instead of the aristocratic title in the above countries.
In the Russian Empire, the word 'царевич, tsarevich' that means 'son of czar' was used instead of the aristocratic title in the above countries.

sen.j: イギリスでは王位継承に男子優先長子相続制を採用しており、欠格事由のない限り、王の長男が法定推定相続人となる。
sen.e: The primogeniture is used for succession of the crown in England, and the first son of the king becomes an heir unless there are any reasons for disqualification.
The primogeniture with priority to male child is used for succession of the crown in England, and the first son of the king becomes an apparent heir unless there are any reasons for disqualification.
sen.cmt: 「男子優先」と「法定推定」の訳を補いました。
sen.e: The primogeniture with priority to male child is used for succession of the crown in England, and the first son of the king becomes an apparent heir unless there are any reasons for disqualification.

sen.j: 王の長男には、プリンス・オブ・ウェールズやコーンウォール公、ロスシー公の称号が授けられる。
sen.e: The first son of the king is given a title of Prince of Wales, the Duke of Cornwall, or the Duke of Rothesay.
The first son of the king is given a title of Prince of Wales, the Duke of Cornwall, or the Duke of Rothesay.
The first son of the king is given a title of Prince of Wales, the Duke of Cornwall, or the Duke of Rothesay.

sen.j: イギリスには王太子 (Crown Prince) という称号はないため、ウェールズ公爵の称号と、王太子という呼称はしばしば同一視される。
sen.e: There is no title of Crown Prince in England, and the Duke of Cornwall is often equated to Crown Prince.
There is no title of Crown Prince in England, and the Duke of Cornwall is often equated to Crown Prince.
There is no title of Crown Prince in England, and the Duke of Cornwall is often equated to Crown Prince.

tit.j: アジア大陸諸国の皇太子・王太子

sen.j: 朝鮮半島においては、高麗のモンゴル帝国干渉期から李氏朝鮮まで他国の冊封体制下にあったため太子の称号が使えず、国王の継承者は「王世子」と呼ばれていたが、日清戦争の結果、下関条約が結ばれた事により清国の冊封から外れ、国号を大韓と改めた際に「皇太子」を使うようになった。
sen.e: Since the Korean peninsula was under the tributary system from the ancient Korean kingdom interference period by the Mongolian Empire to Joseon Dynasty, the successor to the king was called '王世子 (crown prince)', but since the Treaty of Shimonoseki was concluded as a result of Sino-Japanese War, Korea was released from the tributary system of the Qing, the name of the country was changed to Korea and 'Crown Prince' came to be used.
sen.cmt: 王世子は王世子 (crown prince)としました。
sen.e: Since the Korean peninsula was under the tributary system from the Goryeo period which was subjected to the interference by the Mongolian Empire to Joseon Dynasty, the successor to the king was called '王世子 (crown prince)', but since the Treaty of Shimonoseki was concluded as a result of Sino-Japanese War, Korea was released from the tributary system of the Qing,, the name of the country was changed to Korea and 'Crown Prince' came into use.
sen.cmt: 「高麗のモンゴル帝国干渉期」の訳を修正しました。言い回しを修正しました。
sen.e: Since the Korean peninsula was under the tributary system from the Goryeo period which was subjected to the interference by the Mongolian Empire to Joseon Dynasty, the successor to the king was called '王世子 (crown prince)', but since the Treaty of Shimonoseki was concluded as a result of Sino-Japanese War, Korea was released from the tributary system of the Qing,, the name of the country was changed to Korea and 'Crown Prince' came into use.

sen.j: しかし韓国併合により朝鮮は日本の植民地となり、旧皇帝家は『王』家となり、その跡継ぎは王世子となった（前韓國皇帝ヲ册シテ王ト爲シ皇太子及將來ノ世嗣、太皇帝及各其儷匹ノ稱呼ヲ定メ竝ニ禮遇ノ件）。
sen.e: However, Korea became a colony of Japan by the annexation of Korea, the former emperor family became a "king" family, and his successor became 王世子 (crown prince) (act for giving the former Emperor of Korea as a king, defining each evidence of the prince, future successors, and the empress, and treating them with courteous reception).

However, Korea became a colony of Japan by the annexation of Korea, the former emperor family became a "king" family, and his successor became 王世子 (crown prince) (act of making the former Emperor of Korea a king, defining the titles of crown prince, future successors, and their empresses, and treating them with courteous reception).
sen.cmt: as a king→a kingdefining each evidence of the prince→defining the titles of crown prince,に変更しました。
sen.e: However, Korea became a colony of Japan by the annexation of Korea, the former emperor family became a "king" family, and his successor became 王世子 (crown prince) (act of making the former Emperor of Korea a king, defining the titles of crown prince, future successors, and their empresses, and treating them with courteous reception).
